7th_armoured_division.air_support_doctrine: RAF Desert Air Force provided close air support via Hurricane fighter-bombers and Blenheim light bombers. Air-ground coordination via Forward Air Controllers (FACs).
typical_missions: Close air support during major offensives (Battleaxe)

deutsches_afrikakorps.air_support_doctrine: Luftwaffe Fliegerführer Afrika provided direct support to DAK, emphasizing Stuka dive-bombers for precision strikes and Bf 109s for air superiority.
typical_missions: Bf 109 fighter sweeps and bomber escort

ariete_division.air_support_doctrine: Regia Aeronautica provided fighter cover and reconnaissance, but limited close air support capability. Coordination with ground forces often poor.

air_operations_q2_1941: RAF maintained air superiority over Western Desert during Q2
German Bf 109E gradually replaced by Bf 109F (tropical variants)
Italian CR.42 biplanes increasingly obsolete but still widely used
Operation Battleaxe (June 15-17) saw intensive air support on both sides
Tobruk siege involved constant air attacks on garrison and harbor
RAF's Hurricane Mk II (20mm cannons) effective against German armour
Luftwaffe 88mm Flak guns proved deadly to British tanks (dual-role AA/AT)

key_battles_with_air_component.air_activity: RAF provided fighter cover and reconnaissance; Luftwaffe Stukas attacked British armor; both sides contested air superiority
RAF fighters defended garrison; Axis bombers targeted harbor and defenses; constant air-to-air combat
